title: All Marriage On Hold In At Least 1 Alabama County
teaser: Mobile County's probate court says it's not issuing any marriage licenses while it reviews the latest decision on same-sex marriage.
contentencoded:
The probate court in Mobile County, one of Alabama’s largest counties, says it’s not issuing any marriage licenses at all, while it reviews the Alabama Supreme Court’s decision yesterday upholding the state’s voter-approved ban on same-sex marriage.

A federal judge had previously ordered Mobile County’s probate judge to issue same-sex marriage licenses. John Archibald of the Birmingham News joins Here & Now’s Robin Young with details.

Guest

  • John Archibald, columnist for the Birmingham News. He tweets @JohnArchibald.
